bioghist.p: John Elder (1894-1981) and Ruth Roche Elder (b. 1899) were appointed by the Board of Foreign Missions to the East Persia Mission in 1921 and arrived in the field in 1923. Throughout their 42 years of service, they were engaged in evangelistic missionary work, initially in Kermanshah (1923-1934), the Hamadan (1934-1937) and finally in Tehran (1938-1964). Dr. Elder served as the pastor of the Persian-speaking congregations in each city. In 1935, he was Moderator of the newly formed Eastern Presbytery of Iran and was elected Moderator of the Synod of Iran in 1947 and 1960. In addition to numerous other activities, Elder wrote diverse articles, pamphlets and books that were published in both English and Farsi. The Elders retired from missionary service in 1964.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of daily diaries of Ruth Elder from the American Mission, Kermanshah, Persia, 1915-1920 and 1924-1943; correspondence to and from Ruth and John Elder; photographs (family and mission-related); typed articles by Elder on scriptural topics; notes for the memoir "Memories of Life in Persia"; Christmas letters, 1950s-1970s; newsletters; church bulletins; sermons; and tracts. The photographs of mission projects include those of a flood relief project and an album of photos of the rebuilding of a school in Ismatabad (rebuilt by the World Council of Churches after the 1962 earthquake). Additionally, there is an audiocassette of the 1962 Easter service conducted by John Elder in Iran.
